newsitem.title: EGYPT: Israel asks for Suez Canal discounts.
newsitem.headline: Israel asks for Suez Canal discounts.

text.p: Israel asked the state-run Suez Canal Authority (SCA) on Thursday to cut transit fees for some categories of Israeli vessels, SCA chairman Ahmed Ali Fadel told reporters.

Israeli ambassador Zvi Mazel told Fadel at a meeting that Israel would like the authority to give discounts to Israeli ships on long-haul routes such as from the Far East to Europe or between Red Sea ports and the United States, he said.
The Suez Canal Authority gives discounts to ships on long journeys to ensure they do not find it cheaper to take the alternative route around the Cape of Good Hope.
Fadel said he asked the ambassador to provide statistics on the vessels Israel thought should qualify. The authority's economic unit would then assess the request, he added.
